title: Leonardo da Vinci's Flying Machines
description: A quick, practical guide to Leonardo da Vinci's Flying Machines.

hook.text: Four hundred years before the Wright Brothers, Leonardo da Vinci sketched a working helicopter.

buildup.text: He designed the aerial screw in 1489 â€” a spinning rotor meant to compress air and lift off.

discovery.text: He also designed a hang glider, a parachute, and an ornithopter that flapped like a bird.

twist.text: None were ever built in his lifetime. The materials to make them didn't exist yet.

climax.text: In 2000, a skydiver tested Leonardo's parachute design. It worked perfectly after 500 years.

punchline.text: Leonardo was right. He was just 500 years early.
